results.title: Tree of us
results.creator_credit: Vilakone Phachanthavong and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Vilakone has created powerful graphics in this animated work about the family of the future through the use of a predominantly red background, with black and white hand-drawn images. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Father's kite
results.creator_credit: John Shen and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
Poetic 2-D hand-drawn animated tale of a father/son relationship as they share the joys of flying a kite. Music composed and performed by John Shen. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: The Urban migration
results.creator_credit: James Paul and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
This rather grim story in black and white of urbanisation versus nature uses cut-out and hand-drawn animation. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: Nigel & Frank meet their matchbox
results.creator_credit: Sam Howie and Animation and Interactive Media (AIM) RMIT
results.brief_description:
A light-hearted animated story of friendship and just how far two old mates will let greed and envy come between them when they discover a magic matchbox. No dialogue.
Graduate work from an AIM (Centre for Animation and Interactive Media) RMIT graduate, 2006.

results.title: ACMI moving family portraits
results.brief_description:
“Families of all shapes and sizes become part of a mammoth moving image mosaic…”
Created during an “open house” at Fed Square where photographs were taken, by Brett McLennan, of family groups and then projected live as a moving image photomontage.
In partnership with the LaTrobe University Bendigo Department of Visual Arts - Dr James McArdle, Prue Hawkey and Elysia Baker.

results.title: Far away castle: music video by Sunwrae
results.creator_credit: Colin Chee and Multimedia Design, Faculty of Design, Swinburne University of Technology
results.brief_description:
A beautiful aesthetic piece of instrumental contemporary classical music, in rondo form (repetition of a single theme) with various tempi and expressions (music cycle). Colin Chee uses animation to portray music as both a life force and an escape from reality. Ethereal in style, movement and sound.
Music composed by Rae Howell or Sunwrae.

creators_primary.name: Multimedia Design, Faculty of Design, Swinburne University of Technology

results.title: Artist: unknown
results.brief_description:
Being a struggling artist is tough at the best of times but when you’re thousands of miles from home, your debts are mounting and you’re making no money, something’s got to give.
Amy made the long trip from Australia to London to paint. The rent on her workspace is now a month overdue, the landlord is knocking and working part-time in a cafe is not making ends meet. She could try selling her work - but that would entail showing people.
Shot on location in London with original music by Horse Stories. Produced, directed and written by Catherine Green.

results.title: Gods Bones
results.creator_credit: Catherine Sinclair, Samantha Lang and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Angie is pregnant but who is the father? Is it the taxi-driver, the businessman, the actor or the medical student? The potential fathers-to-be are all in for an unexpected mail delivery - a letter with an unusual little parcel. A reminder of what could have been. Based on a short story by Yasunari Kawabata.
Cast: Olivia Pigeot, Brian Vriends, Bogdan Koga, Ritchie Singer, Kiri Paramore
